vulnerability_description: The mysql_native_password authentication plugin is the default authentication plugin that will be used for an account created when no authentication plugin is explicitly mentioned and old_passwords=0 is set. It uses the password hashing algorithm introduced in MySQL 4.1, which is also used by the PASSWORD() function when old_passwords=0 is set. This hashing algorithm is based on SHA-1..
vulnerability_remediation: upgrade to lastest version and disable mysql native password authentication
impact: MySQL instance with enabled native password support is prone to password brute-force attacks
